ai.summary: A rugged 22.6 km countryside loop near Melford Hall in the UK. The route blends grassy fields, farm lanes, and minor woodland paths, with several gates and stiles. The hike is challenging due to length and variable terrain, best tackled by experienced walkers with good navigation and fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly firm farm lanes and grassy fields, interspersed with uneven tracks, stiles, and short woodland sections. Expect muddy footing after rain, occasional exposed sections, and potential livestock on fields. Some gradient changes and uneven surfaces require careful footing.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a full-day hike and check weather and daylight hours before you go. Tell someone your route and expected return time. Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and dress in layered, weatherproof clothing. Carry a map and compass or a reliable offline navigation tool, and know how to use them. Stay on official paths, close gates behind you, and be mindful of livestock. Take plenty of water and high-energy snacks, plus a small first aid kit. Carry a mobile phone with emergency numbers; be aware that signal can be patchy in rural areas. If navigation or weather deteriorates, turn back or seek shelter and call for assistance.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers and a waterproof jacket)
Map and compass or offline GPS
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (April–October) are generally favorable, with longer daylight in summer. Weather can vary, so be prepared for rain and wind, and adjust plans accordingly.

seo.title: Countryside Walk, Melford Hall – 22.6 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Countryside Walk, Melford Hall: a demanding 22.6 km route in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons and gear for a successful hike.
